intro: Vignea leporina var. alpina, commonly known as the alpine hare bean, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish in color. Vignea leporina var. alpina is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and grasslands.
